lead_paragraph: Hydraulic fracturing -- that contentious part of the gas drilling process involving high-pressure injections of water, sand and chemicals deep underground -- took center stage on Tuesday with two forums in Washington and a decision by the New York State Legislature to ban the practice until more is known about its health and environmental impacts.
snippet: The gas industry's practice of hydraulic fracturing came under wide scrutiny, as New York legislators temporarily banned it and industry representatives, environmentalists and regulators debated its merits -- and increased oversight -- in Washington.
abstract: The gas industry's practice of hydraulic fracturing came under wide scrutiny, as New York legislators temporarily banned it and industry representatives, environmentalists and regulators debated its merits -- and increased oversight -- in Washington.
